description: Number of ways of writing n as a sum of 7 squares.
references: Philippe A. J. G. Chevalier, On the discrete geometry of physical quantities, Preprint, 2012.
E. Grosswald, Representations of Integers as Sums of Squares. Springer-Verlag, NY, 1985, p. 121.
G. H. Hardy and E. M. Wright, An Introduction to the Theory of Numbers. 3rd ed., Oxford Univ. Press, 1954, p. 314.
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
P. A. J. G. Chevalier, A "table of Mendeleev" for physical quantities?, Slides from a talk, May 14 2014, Leuven, Belgium.
Shi-Chao Chen, Congruences for rs(n), Journal of Number Theory, Volume 130, Issue 9, September 2010, Pages 2028-2032.
S. C. Milne, Infinite families of exact sums of squares formulas, Jacobi elliptic functions, continued fractions and Schur functions, Ramanujan J., 6 (2002), 7-149.
Index entries for sequences related to sums of squares
formula: G.f.: theta_3(0,x)^7, where theta_3 is the third Jacobi theta function. - _Robert Israel_, Jul 16 2014
maple: series((sum(x^(m^2),m=-10..10))^7, x, 101);# Alternative#(requires at least Maple 17, and only works as long as a(n) <= 10^16 or so):N:= 1000: # to get a(0) to a(N)with(SignalProcessing):A:= Vector(N+1,datatype=float[8],i-> piecewise(i=1,1,issqr(i-1),2,0)):A2:= Convolution(A,A)[1..N+1]:A4:= Convolution(A2,A2)[1..N+1]:A5:= Convolution(A,A4)[1..N+1];A7:= Convolution(A2,A5)[1..N+1];map(round,convert(A7,list)); # _Robert Israel_, Jul 16 2014
mathematica: Table[SquaresR[7, n], {n, 0, 36}] (* _Ray Chandler_, Nov 28 2006 *)SquaresR[7,Range[0,50]] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Aug 26 2011 *)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
